website_summaries.verdict: This remarkably functional cast cover offers incredible arm coverage with an affordable price tag.
pros: Latex-free material works well for those with latex allergies and sensitivities
Incredibly long cast cover with 40 inches of length
Significantly cheaper than other comparable models
cons: Opening hole is smaller than some customers expected, making the product painful to put on

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this product would work well for most people, but not for me. My right (dominant) arm is broken at the elbow and required surgery. It is now in a molded rubber and velcro cast; I must keep it on for showering but cannot get it wet. My left arm is also broken at the elbow, but the bone is not displaced, so the ortho doctor decided that I should be able to use it. However, my left arm is NOT strong enough to hold the rubber seal on the cover to allow passage over the cast. I purchased the product for independence and ease of use but ended up using trash bags instead.
customer_reviews.author: V. Hartman DiSanto

customer_reviews.title: VERY tight seal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before a planned surgery to protect my cast in the shower. However, when I went to use this, I discovered the seal top is so tight that I was unable to use my good hand to even get this over my cast. I then had another person help me - they had to use both their hands & still had a difficult time stretching it over and up my cast. This is a good quality product, but you need a helper to get this on.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Good, 6'3" a bit short
customer_reviews.text: I'll give this 5 stars being it works well, but it is a bit short for taller folks with a full cast like myself. I was barely able to get it over my full cast. Had to make a fist. It was also very tight, though I have muscular arms, I was able to trim the hole a bit bigger. All and all it worked great, not it's fault I am strong and have long arms. It never leaked, even a drop.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but hard to get on and off
customer_reviews.text: We have the full-arm cast version. It works well at keeping the water out, but the tight rubber opening makes it very difficult to get over the cast, especially in the early days when jostling is painful. I was putting it on my kid and having trouble. I can't imagine how somebody would put it on themselves if one of their arms was broken. Once it's on, it does provide a good seal, but always leaves a red mark on the arm from the tight band. Not very comfortable, but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for showering with a cast
customer_reviews.text: This is the hands-down best thing you can buy if you are stuck in a cast. My 11-year-old son broke his arm and was in a cast for six weeks. This was a life saver. I had to help him put it on and off, but I think it might be possible to put on yourself (but it would be very hard). His arm was totally dry after showering, no leaks whatsoever. I couldn’t have imagined trying to tape and use plastic bags after using this.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby S.

customer_reviews.title: NOT Waterproof - Had to replace the cast!
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT waterproof!! In fact, there was more water in the bag than there was on the outside after 1 use in the shower. The condensation was so great, I had to replace my cast! Seriously, I used a good old-fashioned trash bag from Sam's Club after trying this "protector" and my arm was perfectly dry in the shower. Not a good buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Seaman

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. Seal opening will need to be widened for bigger arms.
customer_reviews.text: This does what it's supposed to however I'm a little chubby and the first time I used it I lost circulation to my arm due to the tightness of the seal. Ended up having to cut the rubber to make a larger opening. Only down side is when taking hot showers condensation builds up inside the sleeve but it was never enough to damage the cast.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H

customer_reviews.title: Mine leaked.
customer_reviews.text: Mine leaked. I wore it the first time in the pool but did not submerge it, I kept it mostly elevated on the rubber noodle and rubber dumbbells while I did leg exercises. When I got into the shower room I noticed there was a pool of water inside the protector. The second time I wore it, I wore a plastic bag over my hand held closed at the forearm with a rubber band and then put the Protector over it and made sure the diaphragm was sealed on my forearm. ( It even left a red mark on my arm when I removed it.) It leaked again, getting the outer side of cast wet. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: LA Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Take 2 people to put on & off
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 6’2”-220 pound average size male. After my elbow surgery I was put in a splint across my stomach. It would been impossible for me to put on by myself and once my wife and I got it put on, I couldn’t shower fast enough as the sleeve was cutting off the circulation at my upper bicep muscle. It would then take me and my wife to take it off.
customer_reviews.author: Owen C.

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart while being put on and much too tight even for a small woman's arm
customer_reviews.text: The intent was to cover my 5'0", 120 lb wife's right arm cast so she could shower. This item is very, very difficult to put on over an arm cast because the watertight sleeve's hole is much too tight. The watertight sleeve is so tight it cuts off circulation to the arm and actually hurts. Also the unit, while it was being put on, kept falling apart adding to the difficulty of trying to make it work. I thought the sleeve, which is elastic, would loosen up with usage but just a few stretches shows that the elastic is plainly too tough and will continue to be too tight and too difficult to put over a cast.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schellman

customer_reviews.title: ... hardware from my pinkie finger and this protector was perfect. I have used an arm protector in the ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this protector in anticipation of an upcoming surgery to remove hardware from my pinkie finger and this protector was perfect. I have used an arm protector in the past, so I already knew how good they work. It keeps the hand and bandage completely dry. I would recommend this protector. No need to worry about size, "one size fits all" definitely pertains to this item.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: tight but it does its job
customer_reviews.text: works well. it is really tight so you have to shower quickly because it feels that the circulation is cutting off. you need someone to help you put it on and taking it off as it is almost impossible to put on one-handed, but it does it's job in keepig the cast/ bandage dry. runs long so the "elbow" is not quite at the elbow, but like I said, it serves its purpose
customer_reviews.author: MFF

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product,  can
customer_reviews.text: This item is a life saver and makes shower time so much less stressful with a completely water tight seal. My son has a full arm cast and this really helped him feel more independent and not worried about getting his cast wet. Highly recommend this product if you are in the unfortunate situation of having a cast.
customer_reviews.author: Peg Ricciardelli

customer_reviews.title: HARD TO PUT ON
customer_reviews.text: Watertight, yes - 5 stars for that! The big con is that to be watertight it has to have a very small entrance point for your arm. Perhaps over a cast one could painlessly force it through. However if your surgery is very heavily padded bandageing, shoving a hand and wrist in can be very challenging and a bit painful. That said - what other options are there if you need watertight to shower and wash head of hair? Can't risk bag and tape! So I gave it 3 stars for not being more flexible which I think it could be - having a double flange in more flexible material would be a start and possibly the fix.
customer_reviews.author: agypsyfoot2

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: My son had a major surgery to his hand. He was in 3 separate casts over a period of 12 weeks. This was a life saver when it came to showering. Great quality clear vinyl ‘bag’ with a silicone ring that you put your arm in that completely seals onto the skin forwater tight protection. Totally worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for out of state child age 4. Cast is much thicker than I thought and this pediatric size just doesn't fit. Too bad it can't be returned as it was never used. Will save as I know it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: GGB

customer_reviews.title: Good product, keeps my cast dry
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I had a complete dislocation of my right elbow (with severe ligament damage etc) and have almost a full arm cast. This covers my arm completely. I am 6'1'' tall. It provides a tight seal and provides enough flexibility. It keeps my hand and most importantly, the cast, dry. It works. I bought the Adult long arm with Prime 2 day shipping (arrived on time)
customer_reviews.author: raveye

customer_reviews.title: It works but it hurts
customer_reviews.text: It keeps water off the cast but it was so tight that I needed to shower in just a few minutes or my arm would start hurting. It's a good buy and fulfills its purpose, just don't expect to relax while taking a long bath, it is really tight.
customer_reviews.author: Tania Gerard

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Keeps area dry
customer_reviews.text: Second time I have bought this. First was 7 years ago when I fractured my wrist. The rubber diaphragm had deteriorated so I did purchase another one for a recent surgery. Very good product
customer_reviews.author: bbtosew

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, must have to keep dry!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for keeping your cast/bandage dry! Easy to put on and take off. I have a soft cast that goes up to the middle of my upper arm and I ordered to adult long and there was plenary of room. It would definitely fit over a full arm cast. Don't waste your time trying to keep it dry with a plastic bag and tape! So worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: syrenity101

customer_reviews.title: Dry and covered
customer_reviews.text: Broke my left arm and this saved my sanity. So easy to put on and shower I cannot imagine not having a cover like this for any situation that requires dry appendages.
customer_reviews.author: P. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: This great item has saved my sanity in dealing with my son's arm cast!!
customer_reviews.text: This item is a god send in dealing with my 4 year old's broken arm. Fits tight but not uncomfortably and keeps the cast perfectly dry. My son doesn't mind having it on during bath time. Item is made from heavy duty materials and of course, re-usable. A friend had recommended this to me. Neither my MD or the physical therapists I work with had heard of this cast protector. The company should advertise it more, it's the perfect answer to dealing with bathtime in a cast. They offer it for leg casts,too. Loved the Amazon Prime 2-day shipping!!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny in Miami

customer_reviews.title: Awkward...
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to use if you do not have someone to help you get it on. Once on it was not very comfortable around the seal and getting it off I had to have help. I tossed this out after the first use and went back to my 30 gallon hefty bag with painters tape - I never had any water get it in and it was much easier to do by myself. No I would not recommend based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Tbone

customer_reviews.title: I had surgery on my elbow and hand, was ...
customer_reviews.text: I had surgery on my elbow and hand, was not allowed to get the area wet for 3 weeks. I purchased this product so I could still take a shower. No water got in, the seal is extremely tight. If you have had surgery be prepared for it to hurt, but it does what it's suppose to do and that is to keep water out!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa K Scroggins

customer_reviews.title: Check the size carefully
customer_reviews.text: I got an adult size short arm. This thing is HUGE!....much too large for my arm. But it does keep my bandages dry.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorDiva

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed NOT RETURNABLE!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s very unfortunate your unable to return. My 4 year old broke his arm and we are headed camping, so I bought this think in the slight chance it would be too big I could return it. Well it runs VERY SMALL. I didn’t even put it on him. So never used, but unable to return. I’m very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: B.Ree

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking at various ones, this IS the ONE to get!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a cast on my hand/wrist up to just below the elbow. This item worked GREAT and I would suggest anyone that needs to keep their arm/hand dry get one of these. It is durable and I've been using it just over 4 weeks - 1 more or so to go with the cast. I had no worries of leaking. It does the intended job of keeping you dry perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: DanR

customer_reviews.title: This is extremely durable. Great for showing after surgery or with a cast on.
customer_reviews.text: It's very durable and has a water tight seal so you can shower after surgery or with a cast. This is the best thing since sliced bread!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Evans

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It definitely doesn't leak and it beats wrapping up in plastic bags every time but it's extremely tight (almost too tight) and I bought for my son's arm so i could only image it on an adult's much bigger arm like this one was made for. Not to mention it's very tough to put on & truly hope you have someone around to help put it on and take it off. But it does work and that's a plus
customer_reviews.author: kimberly

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: My sister is 13 this is big on her but honestly that part doesn't really matter. It covers her cast and it prevents any water from damaging the cast in the shower. It's a good quality product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked
customer_reviews.text: You're not gonna win The top model award but it does the job it held up for five weeks with diaphragm hole was kind of tight I had to cut it open to make it a bit wider.., Big arm problems lol
customer_reviews.author: hagz

customer_reviews.title: Enables you to take a shower with no worries
customer_reviews.text: My brother broke his wrist at work and we got so tired of the old "wrapping plastic bags with masking tape" I remembered when my son broke his leg, I found one at the DME store. It worked wonders and his cast never got wet. Worked like a charm and it's so easy to put on and take off with no assistance needed. It's made of a very durable plastic and the seal is soft and non-abrasive. No one wants to need this, but if there is a need, I highly recommend adding this to your cart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing protection!
customer_reviews.text: I broke my hand this summer and this gave me so much of my freedom back. Not only could I shower with ease, I was even able to go swimming in a lake with this and my cast never got soaked. Something to note is that your hand will become slightly damp because of the humidity that accumulates
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Martineau

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to put over my cast for a broken wrist. The hole in the gasket was so small that I couldn't even get the cast in a bit due to the pain it caused my wrist. Nowhere did i see a description of the gasket size. Now they are telling me it's not returnable. Don't waste your money on this! i'll continue using newspaper delivery sleeves with an elastic.
customer_reviews.author: ann leffert

customer_reviews.title: Hard to put on by yourself, but otherwise does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for use after both my daughter and I broke our wrists in the same week. It is really well constructed. We have not had any problem with leaking into the cast area.The only difficulty comes in that it is very hard to put on and take off one-handed. The seal is so snug that you basically need a second person to use. Otherwise, it's great and does exactly what it is intended to do at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Erick G.

customer_reviews.title: this worked great. my 11 year old daughter was in a ...
customer_reviews.text: this worked great. my 11 year old daughter was in a cast for a month and not a drop of water got in. We had tried another brand but it was way to hard to get on and off. This one was pretty easy to get on and off but too her and myself to do it because it was too awkward for her to manage herself. loved it
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: Did the job and durable
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect for a long arm cast I had. Very durable material and would be very hard to rip. You can put it on by yourself, but if your fracture is still sensitive, then it will hurt if you do it by yourself. Doing it with one person's help will prevent it from touching/hitting/dragging your cast or hand when taking it off and on. By the way, heed their advice that it is not for recreational/submersion use (eg under water in pool). I tested it...LOL.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Used post operation for hand
customer_reviews.text: It kept the cast/dressings of surgical site very dry, but it was WAY too LONG for me! Do they make one 12" shorter?
customer_reviews.author: life-loverML

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: The protector does a good job at sealing around your arm. It's a little long, for just as forearm like shown in the picture. Tha'ts with a guy who is 6'8" and has long arms. The seal is incredibly hard to get past the cast for me. Kind of painful really. I know not all casts are made the same so maybe others won't have the problem. Either way, once its on, the Brown Medical SEAL-TIGHT Original Cast and Bandage Protector does a great job of keeping water out when taking a shower.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: So much better than garbage bags and rubber bands.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. It is so much better than garbage bags and rubber bands. It keeps my cast perfectly dry. It is thick vinyl but allows reasonable maneuverability. The seal is definitly tight, but that keeps the water out!
customer_reviews.author: immercd

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your arm cast dry!
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I had the displeasure of finding this gadget after fracturing both my knee and elbow at the same time. I had a removable brace for my knee but a partial cast for my elbow for a couple weeks. This cast and bandage protector worked very well for my arm cast and kept it dry. Now it's in my closet and I'm hoping that I don't ever have to use it again!
customer_reviews.author: Beckles

customer_reviews.title: Better than described by the manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Works very well! Better than described by the manufacturer! It's a little tedious to put on depending on the diameter of your cast but seals tight and is much better than a bread bag and tape! Been using this on my son for about 5 weeks! Still like new and no smell! Makes it much easier for him to shower! Very fair price considering the convieience and that its reusable!
customer_reviews.author: tim woodworth

customer_reviews.title: but nothing works as good as this does
customer_reviews.text: I've tried everything else, but nothing works as good as this does. You could literally take a bath with this and not a drop would get in. One important note, though: I have small arms and it's very snug on me. It can stretch a LOT, but I have no idea what would happen on a large man.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie_StPeters

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Cast Cover
customer_reviews.text: Taping a bag over my sons cast was out of the question due to his phobia of sticky substances, but this cast cover was a life saver. Its a perfect fit, not to loose or to tight. Its an air tight seal, nothing gets in it. Light weight, durable.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Works ok for hard casts.
customer_reviews.text: i used it once and it worked good but I have a soft cast (ace bandage from upper arm down to knuckles) and it was too hard to get on and off. It almost tore the cast off. Would use it for a hard cast. The seal was real tight.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for our teenager who needed his cast covered during showers. Sealed up perfectly, but not with discomfort. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, Works perfect with a cast! Great for parents!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great with a cast! Easy to put on and keeps your arm dry just as described. If you can't put this on by yourself, you've got problems. That being said, I probably would't recommend for after surgery as others have suggested, just for use with a hard cast because the seal at the bottom is tight and would hurt as it's going down your arm. For use with a cast though...perfect! Great for showering, but also for parents who have to do the dishes, give baths, etc!
customer_reviews.author: Nicki Bunt

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after I broke my wrist and needed surgery. It was way better then having to deal with trash bags and tape with one hand. Its made out of good material that water bounces off of and the seal will keep all the water out. Give it time the first 3-4 times using it the seal is very tight and might need an extra person to help but once it fits to you arm size it works!
customer_reviews.author: Joey15a

customer_reviews.title: Totally Recommeded!!
customer_reviews.text: It worked out great for my son. It's a great product for anyone with a cast. My son's arm kept dry while in the tub, even when it got wet in the tub.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Stewart

customer_reviews.title: OK, but the product is not exactly like the picture.
customer_reviews.text: The length is quite longer than represented in the picture. I could be used for the leg rather than the arm it is so long. Since it is long, it makes it difficult to grab anything with the injured arm because of the excess plastic. I would have sent it back if I did not need it immediately with my arm length cast. On a positive note, it works well in keeping water out.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn S.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, after some alteration
customer_reviews.text: Broke my wrist and had a cast for 6 weeks, so I needed a way to take a shower without using a bunch of bags and tape. Protects cast perfectly, but unless you have the arm of an infant, you will have to alter the seal. It stands up well to the alterations, just be cautious and only cut small bits at a time so that you don't destroy the seal. Other than that, happy camper and dry cast!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Rafeedie

customer_reviews.title: Effective but painful
customer_reviews.text: I would only recommend this being used on a hard cast and not severe injury. Used this on a soft cast while awaiting elbow surgery and was in tears at the end. Yes, it kept my cast dry. But once it was on, we had to move super fast because the band on top cut off my circulation. When removing it, we almost had to cut it off. My arm feels more injured after using it. :(
customer_reviews.author: Katie Yi

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend if you are very thin
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 13 year old son, who is 5'7" and it seemed to fit but it leaked so much that the fingertip area filled with about an inch of water during his shower. It is possible his arms were too skinny for it. I would recommend if you are very thin, you should wear it high up on your arm where it could fit tighter, or order a children's size.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra McCarter

customer_reviews.title: Must have a helper.
customer_reviews.text: It works!! But it’s difficult to put on. You’ll need help.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Great product that makes life easier in a difficult time
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with garbage bags and rubber bands. This product makes bathing with a cast so much easier. You will still want to keep it from direct water flow, but you will have a much easier time getting this on and keeping your cast and under bandages wet than struggling with garbage bags. You won't dread showering, even everyday, with the Seal Tight Cast Protector. I've had one for a leg and an arm. It's totally worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Warren

customer_reviews.title: My daughter broke her arm right before leaving for Zion ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter broke her arm right before leaving for Zion National Park. It worked really well for keeping splashed out,however this can not be submerged! It is also really large. Worked for dba we needed it for and will order another if needed...I hope not!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Seal tight is right.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my husband who broke his wrist and has a cast on. It is a perfect length for a man's arm but is REALLY tight at the seal/top and a bit tricky to get on and off over the cast without help. Definitely won't let water it - just maybe may cut off a man's arm circulation a bit during showers!
customer_reviews.author: TFA

customer_reviews.title: This worked well for my extra long armed husband that ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for my extra long armed husband that only needed his lower arm covered. If you don't have a cast past your elbow, consider getting a size smaller because as you can see from the picture on the box, it is L shaped and extends well beyond the elbow area.
customer_reviews.author: Raewyn

customer_reviews.title: Saved the DAY!!
customer_reviews.text: Son had surgery, and showering was definitely a chore. This definitely made life much easier. WE had to cut the opening to allow for the size of his arm, but after that showering was a much easier job. When going through a recovery anything to make life easier is much appreciated. THANK you for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Worked at beach, pool, and showers for an 8 year old girl with somewhat chubby arms
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an 8 year old girl to go over her cast that was up past her elbow and not waterproof. We used this at the beach, pool, and showers. The adult full arm fit her well around the upper arm (chubby arms), and we just used a rubber band to wrap up the excess arm bag part. Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Masters

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: This was awesome my daughter has a cast for a little over a month and because of this sleeve it never got wet.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Lawless

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders. Saved is a lot of headache and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works wonders. Saved is a lot of headache and pain from having to use a plastic bag and tape on my son's arm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and my limb dry! Intended to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Very durable and my limb dry! Intended to use after carpal tunnel surgery but have been using for my left ankle. A little awkward bit it works!
customer_reviews.author: Djpandst

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Mom shattered her elbow and this work great, exactly what she needed, cast stay dry.
customer_reviews.author: melendezjerbear

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Greattt product. My husband has a full cast that goes above his elbow and this has been a god sent. It keeps his cast dry. Happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Anne AbdTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little too big but it did the job and no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Harper

customer_reviews.title: I bought this when I broke my wrist. First ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I broke my wrist. First of all, the smell of the plastic was horrendous! Second, it was very hard to get over my broken wrist with just one hand. The opening was so tight, that I ended up giving up on the whole thing and just using a trash bag. Not worth the $$.
customer_reviews.author: "buggaloo72"

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Has kept the cast dry through showers and baths. A nurse suggested it to me and so thankful for this help. Can't believe I hadn't heard of this before.
customer_reviews.author: Verified purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was so tight that it cut the circulation in arm temporarily until I took it off after my shower, but it worked! No water got in and it did it's job. I broke two of my bones in left elbow and although this is easier to put on with assistance, I was able to put it on myself with just my right arm. It just took a little long.
customer_reviews.author: AhhChoooo

customer_reviews.title: Too Tight For My Arm
customer_reviews.text: This cover is an excellent product.....it just didn't work for me. It was very hard for me to put on and it got so tight on my arm that I had too cut it off. My arms are not that big so I'm not really sure what happened,
customer_reviews.author: R. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, it seals well but was hard to put on over long cast.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rees

customer_reviews.title: arm cast cover
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sister when she was in a cast-much easier than the duct tap and garbage bag. It does take two people to put on as the rubber seal has to be stretched over the cast to get it on. It also is very long-almost 8" longer than where her hand ends, she rests it just above the top of her cast which fell right below the elbow. It does what it suppose to and keep water out.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Size matters.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband's broken humerus. It was way too tight to get over his soft cast so had to return. It does look like a great product if your a skinny model as shown and your break is lower arm; not good for upper arm.
customer_reviews.author: glmunde

customer_reviews.title: This is total crap. should state thats its made for runway models ...
customer_reviews.text: Wat a load of garabage, how do they expect an adult to use this, the openeng is barely big enough to fit without a cast on, got it on finally and after about 2 minutes the circulation to my arm was being cut off. This is total crap.should state thats its made for runway models and children
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: amazing job!
customer_reviews.text: simply unbelievable! it just works! great product at great price!
customer_reviews.author: some guy

customer_reviews.title: Can't get on with one hand
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a good product but I was never able to get it over my arm cast with one hand because the elastic membrane was too tight. By the time I could drive again I was unable to return it because the window for returns had ended.
customer_reviews.author: PEG MCC

customer_reviews.title: Worked super well! My boyfriend broke his hand and had ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked super well! My boyfriend broke his hand and had surgery a few weeks before we went to Mexico so he wasn’t allowed to get it wet. This didn’t let any water in and worked great throughout our whole trip
customer_reviews.author: Kylee Herman

customer_reviews.title: It's tight, but....
customer_reviews.text: It is tight! Even on my 15 year old skinny son. BUT... I figured out you can put a rolled up towel in there for a day and it stretched out a bit. Happy with my purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: Smokey

customer_reviews.title: Hand poncho
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to keep my bandage dry. Felt good to be able to use hand in the shower knowing things would stay dry
customer_reviews.author: Judy C. Gay

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t fit and won’t let me return. We can’t use it. I bought 3 sizes just in case and am now out $80.
customer_reviews.author: Allison D. Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: not good with splints
customer_reviews.text: I had a splint on my hand to almost the elbow. It would have been covering that area, but because the splint was wrapped with bandages to stay in place, I could not fit the wrapped splint through the tight rubber opening without displacing the splint. I could not use this.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth W.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great to keep my son's arm dry after surgery
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to keep my son's arm dry after surgery. The top seal was a bit tight, but we trimmed it slightly and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: Came in very handy when I had surgery. Little tight on the arm but works good
customer_reviews.author: ann williams

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier. The seal is tight
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly. Had carpal tunnel surgery on my right hand, then 2 weeks later had my left hand done. I had to keep my hands dry for 2 weeks each. Didn't want to deal with baggies and tape for 4 weeks so I decided to give this a try. Couldn't be happier. The seal is tight, so you definitely need help getting it on and off, but my kids helped me everyday and I never had a problem. I recommend this very highly.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Banta

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 5 year old son who has a cast that goes up midway between his elbow and shoulder. The ring is tight (like it should be) and keeps water out when he showers or takes a bath. The length of the bag is a little too long though and would probably work better for an older child with longer arms.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Works Well!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cover my sons cast in the shower after he broke his arm. Keeps all water out and cast dry. Would recommend again.
customer_reviews.author: Chelcamp

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Great product but you may need help putting it on over a large cast.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly for my mother. She broke her arm and had to have surgery. Her cast is almost to her shoulder. It's a little difficult to get on, but I don't see how you would be able to buy something that works as good as this does without being difficult to get on. It's fairly easy to get off.
customer_reviews.author: erin d

customer_reviews.title: So glad a friend told me about this after a recent ...
customer_reviews.text: So glad a friend told me about this after a recent surgery. Made showering without assistance possible and kept my surgery site completely dry.
customer_reviews.author: J. Haubert

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you're ordering the right item
customer_reviews.text: My own fault for not reading the description more closely - I received the full-arm cast cover, instead of the one that's pictured. This item is designed to extend over the elbow, while we just needed the one that ends below the elbow.
customer_reviews.author: LawLib13

customer_reviews.title: very efficient
customer_reviews.text: This is being used for a hand/wrist cast for a broken thumb. It is apparently made of durable plastic with a tight rubber ring inside the outer blue ring. It is easy enough to put on using the other hand and it keeps the cast dry like advertised. It is warranted for the life of the cast.
customer_reviews.author: snorton

customer_reviews.title: This is not good if you have an issue with your elbow & ...
customer_reviews.text: This is not good if you have an issue with your elbow & need to be able to support your arm.
customer_reviews.author: Missing Mitsu

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I had a hand operation in April and this glove fit very well over a large bandage and a splint too. Kept tight around the arm to prevent water coming through but not too tight. Am submitting this review a year after my operation because I could not type very well until now.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It isn't luxury, but it keeps a cast dry. Plastic ring is approx 5 inches across (inner diameter), so measure your cast before buying. Rubber seal squeezes tight, as it should to keep out water. I recommend a small terry cloth towel inside to protect against any incidental moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wizowski

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I had foot surgery and this was a life saver for the first 2 weeks
customer_reviews.author: MONICA BOSEMAN

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my daughter an it worked fine for about 7 weeks but most cast' s can ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter an it worked fine for about 7 weeks but most cast' s can be on for 10 to 12 weeks. It has a split in the seam. I will have to purchase a new protector for the remainder of the week's. I would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: helen

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: the cast protector works great .... cast does not get wet. The seal is tight and does not allow water to enter the sleave.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Watch what size you pick
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a small hand and arm. We chose the appropriate size. It would NOT go over the wrist cast. I had to cut slits around the rubber water seal to allow it to go over the cast and still protect her arm from water. It's a good product, but be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck S.

customer_reviews.title: Tight seal but ...
customer_reviews.text: The Seal-Tight bandage protector worked as advertised, but it also pulled my cloth bandages from my hand and wrist each time I used it. It's perfect for people with hard cast, but it's very difficult to pull over cloth raps without destroying the rapped layers.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: not for an uncasted ound
customer_reviews.text: nope - the hole is way too small for use over a wound-
customer_reviews.author: David Reynolds

product_meta.title: Seal-Tight Original Cast Protector Waterproof Cast Cover for Arm, Long (40in Length)
feature_bullets: Waterproof. The Seal-Tight Original cast protector lets you shower or bathe without getting your cast/dressomg wet. This Waterproof cast cover and bandage protector creates a snug fit to maintain a Waterproof seal. Its polyvinyl bag is extra Durable.

Easy to use. Seal-Tight Durable way to keep water out during showering or bathing.Its easy-to-apply application ring eliminates the need for strapping, pumps or hook-and-loop closures. Non-Latex diaphragm stretches over cast to form watertight seal.

Time-tested. Recommended by doctors, Seal-Tight Original Cast and Bandage Protector is the #1 brand name in cast and bandage protection. The innovative design gives you the confidence that you re using the most Trusted solution available.

No Latex. Rather than using natural rubber Latex, the Seal-Tight Original cast protector is designed with a polyvinyl bag and non-Latex diaphragm ring to seal water out. So there's never a worry about an allergic skin reaction.
Reusable. This cast cover's durable materials will last the life of the cast or dressing, eliminating the need for costly cast replacement.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
